To clarify, the women being held ranged in age, including some in their 50s and 60s. Additionally, 2 of the women we met with suffered from epilepsy. It was heartbreaking on so many levels.

"We were able to get into a cell that was holding 15 women -- many of them were crying. They had been 56 days at this border station. They went 9 to 15 days without a shower."

This is a human rights crisis and it has to change -- now. https://abcnews.go.com/Politics/video/rep-madeleine-dean-troubling-situation-border-64072287¬†‚Ä¶

We were met with hostility from the guards, but this is nothing compared to their treatment of the people being held.

The detainees are constantly abused and verbally harassed with no cause. Deprived physically and dehumanized mentally - everyday.

This is a human rights issue.

Just left the first CBP facility. The conditions are far worse than we ever could have imagined. 

15 women in their 50s- 60s sleeping in a small concrete cell, no running water. Weeks without showers. All of them separated from their families. 

This is a human rights crisis.
Every single word of this is true. I am horrified by what I just saw. This should not be a partisan issue ‚Äî it‚Äôs a human rights issue. https://twitter.com/AOC/status/1145764653835964419¬†‚Ä¶
